meanings.definition: To exist or continue to exist
meanings.sent1: In the harsh desert, only the hardy plants can subsist.
meanings.sent2: Despite the storm, the old house managed to subsist.
meanings.sent3: The little seedling tried to subsist on just a few drops of water.
meanings.sent4: Her hope seemed to subsist like a flickering candle in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins subsist as a reminder of a forgotten civilization.

meanings.definition: To support oneself at a minimal level
meanings.sent1: With his meager earnings, he could barely subsist in the city.
meanings.sent2: The homeless man had to subsist on scraps of food found in the trash.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat could subsist on love alone.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship helped him subsist through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The small village subsisted on fishing for their livelihood.

meanings.sent1: The delicate ecosystem can only subsist with careful conservation efforts.
meanings.sent2: The business could only subsist if it adapted to changing market trends.
meanings.sent3: The rumor mill seemed to subsist on gossip and speculation.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship subsisted through years of trials and tribulations.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of storytelling subsists in many cultures around the world.
